review: Wish I would've written a review sooner, as I have had nothing but good things to say on prior visits. But sometimes it's the bad experiences that stand out, which I guess is how we get honest reviews on Yelp.  Normally my husband and I come in 2-3 times a month, we always sit at the bar and have always had great service, great food, and for a corporate family establishment, we were pleased and would give 5 stars. Tonight we noticed that for a while now, the bar staff has been sub par. We always had Summer as our bartender, but we haven't seen her lately. Tonight we had Shauna and she just didn't seem comfortable behind the bar. From my experience, both as a bartender, and as a guest who prefers to sit at the bar, most bartenders command their domain. They move with purpose and are very good at multi tasking, delegating, and consolidating tasks. That was not the case tonight. She was kind, and would probably make a decent server, but don't feel her place is behind the bar. I felt the same way about the bartender on our last visit. It leads me to believe that this location may be having difficulties keeping their bartenders, and it may deter us from coming back and sitting at the bar again. The service is just too slow now, and the bar has lost its personality. It saddens me because this has been a tradition of ours since we moved to Simi 7 years ago.

This place has gone way down hill. Ordered BBQ chicken pizza. Barely any chicken. The pizza surface was about 50% crust. Area for toppings (cheese, onions, chicken, sauce, etc.) was very small. Kids ordered mac n cheese. On kids plate and one adult. Kids plate had more.  For adult portion, they put mac n cheese in this huge dish but the reality is the actual part that holds the mac n cheese is very small. It's an illusion and a very CHEAP trick. Something you won't see at Cheesecake Factory which is the gold standard in chain restaurants.  Not sure if they changed ownership or started franchising, but CPK is nowhere close to what they were years ago. Obviously their motto is to make your servings appear larger than they are by putting them on huge plates or spreading the crust out to cover the whole plate while putting the toppings on a small diameter.  They keep this up they'll be the next big chain to close shop.

We visited this establishment last night on June 8th 2017. We had a large group of 14 people, it was a graduation party. Everyone ran the waiter ragged and that is putting it lightly. This waiter was so good at his job he had a nice disposition he was very attentive fast and friendly. I was very impressed by his ability to handle a large group without looking stressed at all. I definitely will be back to this establishment and ask for Nick. I want to thank Nick for doing a fabulous job keeping everybody happy. even the older people.! your personality and awesome attitude kept the whole table happy you rock Nick! I love California Pizza Kitchen the food there is amazing I had the roasted veggie chicken salad and I was very satisfied.  The rest of our group were all happy with their meals as well. Thank you for embracing our table  and celebrating with our graduates . you should really keep Nick around he's an awesome waiter!!!!

Nice place to grab a bite to eat. The service was nice and we didn't wait long but I think that was because the was just a few people there for dinner. The food was good and I had no problem with the choices. There is a lot to choose from on their menu. I had the shrimp Alfredo pasta which was delicious. They could have cleaned the seats a little better though... Before seating anyone.

The setting for this venue couldn't' have come at a better time.This dinner plans was for some of my family members to come over into this area of town,the timing was perfect,because of the events that occurred last week in San Bernardino.The family members being a part of one of the several agencies that responded to the events that unfolded. As we all entered where greeted right away from the Hostess and was seated within about 5 minutes. We wanted to sit outside,but it was a bit nippy.The view of this location is fantastic.With all its lights. I had the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine and my family had several different dishes and we all enjoyed them very well. The servers where very attentive during our complete visit.The store very well maintained,and most of all very clean.Good job. For desert we had the pumpkin cheesecake.This is a limited item,so they may not have anymore,but it was delouses. Overall had a great time.Will return.Great Job.

My mom and I come here once a month to ensure that we are able to spend some time together. We end up staying and talking for hours!! The food is so good, we get the same thing every time!! Garlic cream fettuccine!! So yummy, and my mom always enjoys the cocktails she gets!!

Meals at California Pizza Kitchen seldom disappoint us.  Most of the time, my wife and I are craving the Waldorf Chicken Salad, but we usually indulge in something else as well such as pasta or a pizza. They seem to be inconsistent lately as far as bringing their fresh bread and olive oil to our table. The last three times we never received it and the time before that we had to ask for it after waiting until after our entrees had already arrived. The food tastes great but sometimes I wonder how they measure their portions.  Between eating in the restaurant and using their take out service, as well as ordering their full salad and their half salad, we are still left wondering what the best bang for the buck is. Overall, we will continue to eat here but possibly not as frequently.

The employee Gage hit on my girlfriend and asked her to go to dinner with him. I don't know how they can hire such a rude and unprofessional person. All she wanted to do was have a nice lunch without being bothered.

This location is usually slow, so you get better service and the servers are attentive.   The food is good. It's really casual, so  it's perfect for a first date, or perfect to bring the family.   They have a Korean BBQ pizza that's new and that's really good.   They do a lot of charities and fundraisers, so that's why I love this place. I'll definitely be back.

Just tried the Jamaican jerk pizza on regular crust for the first time and it was very good. The sauce was sweet and spicy just how it should be and the chicken was also rubbed with the Jamaican jerk seasoning. The pizza also came with yellow and orange bell pepper which also made the pizza sweet and came with Applewood smoked bacon. I highly recommend trying this pizza if you haven't done so already!

I met a friend for lunch here... big mistake! We where seated right away then it just took a a nose dive from there. The service was horrible, it took 30 minutes from the time we ordered until we got our food. I got an ice tea and I had to ask for sweetener there was none on the tables,I had to ask for some and that took about 15 min to get. I ordered an original BBQ chopped Chicken salad. No kidding there was about 6 very small pieces on chicken on it and I seem to remember some cheese on it in the past, not now. And a spoon full of corn. It was just very light on the  ingredients. Don't waste  your time or money on this one.

Horrible, Horrible, Horrible. I got 2 salads to take out. When I got home the arugula was all stems and there was virtually no dressing. The second (for my friend) was not good either. We also ordered the Cauliflower appetizer - It was burnt and we couldn't eat it. Most of our dinner ended up it the trash. When I called the manager he said he would make it right by sending me 2 -$15 gift cards. Well, that never happened. I will not be going back to this CPK!

Much better experience this time around. The first time I was here, I ordered the bbq salad and hated it so much that I returned it. This time I went with the chicken Cesar salad and it's much better. I liked how the chicken was seasoned. At the half portion, it was quite filling. The Hawaiian pizza is ok. I'm a fan of the avocado rolls and sausage mushroom pizza.

My food was great. We went to celebrate my girlfriend's parents as well as my own parents birthdays all at once. I had the mushroom, sausage and pepperoni pizza. Pizza was amazing. Sauce was great. Delicious pizza. Service wasn't the greatest.

Kinda sad ... Ordered online ...pick up in 18 minutes "awesome" ... Well after paying ...we waited and waited ...30 minutes !!! Finally went inside and demanded our order .... As it had been sitting there the whole time.. Cold pizza .. Cold pasta... Pasta has barely any sauce and a scant bit of chicken...really sad as this used to be a go to spot... We won't be ordering again...way too expensive for what we received .

I'm writing this based on the food. I highly recommend the Pest Cream Penne literally 10/10. I get it every single time I go and literally never get tired of it. It is an amazing choice if you are vegetarian too! Sorry don't have a pic of it. But trust my word. It's delicious if you are a pasta lover like myself.

Our server was awesome! This review is from our late dinner on Monday 8/9/16 so kudos to our server in the front section of the restaurant at 8pm. Awesome job.  I had the chicken piccata & my boyfriend had the Ribeye steak "As rare as possible" ..But that's the way he likes it.

The service was really slow. It took a while for the hostess to seat six of us in the party. The restaurant  at this point was not busy atb all.  Once we did get seated we were in the far corner away from everything.  Food was ok. I got a pasta shrimp dish.  The pasta was kind of cold.

As a pregnant pizza fanatic I was excited to finally give this place a try. At 2 in the afternoon there were maybe a couple open tables which is always a good sign for me. A busy business must be a good business, right? My excitement soon turned to disappointment when our food arrived. My pizza was a flimsy cardboard-like texture that couldn't hold its pathetic amount of cheese and toppings. Taste wise it was alright but definitely not worth $14 for a personal pizza.  Food: 2 stars Service: 3 stars Atmosphere: 3 stars  Overall: 2 stars

The food was pretty yummy the service was great and their facilities were clean butttt unfortunately my fork was dirty it looked as if the food that was stuck between the fork had been there for days because it was really dry and disgusting.

My wife and I stopped by on the evening of our anniversary for a bite to eat. While I am not too fond of the newer CPK menu, we found something. Our server, Tyler, was courteous, professional and an overall nice guy. :) I ordered fish tacos but when the food was delivered, they were pork tacos. Tyler profusely apologized, verified that he entered the order correctly and promptly worked on getting the corrected meal. About five minutes later, the manager came by and delivered the corrected order as well as state that he will comp the order due to the mishap. Now that is GREAT customer service. So why not five stars? Well, for the service I would give five stars. It was refreshing to see great customer service. While the food was alright, it was the service that was outstanding. Admittedly, I am generally underwhelmed with restaurant food these days but great service is a significant contributor to the overall experience. To that end, Tyler and the store manager (sorry but I did not get a name) did not disappoint.
Went back for a new salad. Got nothing but nasty attitude. Customer service is dead in this country friends. Dead!

Food was great as usual.  Service was not bad but not up to the usual service provided when dinning indoors.  It took longer than usual for the server to greet and take the order.  Once the order was taken things went smoothly  but then fell apart again towards the end.  I think the server forgot about our table because it took forever for us to get the bill. I got the sense that the server was new because he lacked confidence and was a bit intimidated every time he approached us.

As a bonafide pizza lover, I've had great pie and some not-so-great pie.  Things that make a great pie are a tasty and moist crust.  The kind that you can fold in half with the ingredients inside.  Sauce made from fresh ingredients, lots and lots of genuine mozzarella cheese and of course so many toppings, that you can't see the cheese  - all served piping hot... What you get at CPK is a very thin, hard, dry cracker-like crust that crumbles in your hand.  The crust is usually over cooked and shows signs of burning on some of the edges.  Then they skimp on the sauce, which may or may not actually have tomatoes in it.  They then apply what they consider to be "gourmet" cheese, which is usually everything BUT genuine mozzarella.  Finally instead of classic pizza toppings such as pepperoni, Canadian bacon, Italian sausage, anchovies and black olives, you get a smallish pie with foo-foo light and healthy toppings, which are about as appealing as a plate of alfalfa smothered in light ranch dressing.   It seriously reminds me of a giant overcooked Ritz cracker with some hors devours toppings on it.  And on top of that, it's extremely overpriced. For truly great pizza, go to Toppers, Roundtable or Rock & Roll Pizza instead.  Even Pizza Hut easily outperforms CPK and it's a lot cheaper and more fun...  They may not be as trendy or "hip" as California Pizza Kitchen, but your mouth & pocketbook will thank you for it.

CPK doesn't serve standard pizza with cheese and sausage. It has a wide variety of toppings that are very tasty and actually the pizzas don't have much cheese. The service at the Simi Valley restaurant always seems to be good even when it's very busy. I'm reluctant to share this but I really like the fact that one can call ahead to put your name on the waiting list if you will show up in a few minutes. We do that every time.

Food was okay. Went there around noon. The waitress to customer ratio was appalling. The service was ultra slow. Each time we saw the waitress it took her 10 minutes in some cases to respond to our request. I observed the waitress and she was more than busy. I don't know if this was a one type of incident where they had multiple sick call outs or the manager is not managing this location. Whatever the issue is, it was not handled well. We won't be going there anytime soon. Pretty sorry situation.

This location is probably the best CPK I've been to! Mostly in part to our server Pedro. He refilled my boyfriend's drink before he had even finished the first one. He was so on top of it and checked in with us frequently. Overall, we had a great experience here and will come back again!

Dropped in with hubby, kidlet, and my mom yesterday. Place wasn't too busy but it still took forever for our waiter to come back and take our order after taking the drink options. By this point kidlet was getting anxious and didn't want to sit for long, already bored with the crayons. The appetizer came out mere two minutes before the main dishes. Hubby's pizza was wrong AGAIN (see prior review) and the waiter tells us it is correct but hubby was pretty certain it said no bell pepper,yet there it was. After he's halfway through eating and having picked off the peppers, the manager comes over saying the pizza was indeed incorrect and brought a new one. The waiter tells us the recipe was changed recently to thin crust and a few things were changed with ingredients.  I'm fine with places wanting to go healthy but kidlet was mighty angry that her chicken didn't have fries with it. Can't really placate an already bored, starving toddler with broccoli. I heard several other kids near us complaining of the same thing. Menu was downsized and prices were not decent compared to potion size. Reminds me of a recent visit to Famous Dave's also at the mall, both restaurants seem on the way out.

I usually enjoy coming to cpk. Although this is my second time at this location, I have yet to have decent service. I've sat both at table and bar area. Seems like they only have one person working the bar area who also runs the tables. I waited over 5 min to be greeted, another 5 to get my water and another 5 to just order my appetizer. My waiter was def working hard running around serving other guest as well, yet I never got to place my order for my dinner. Guests who got there after me placed and received their dinner order and I had yet to place mine. At this point I've been waiting for 30 minutes. Only thing I received was my appetizer , water and Coke. I never got a refill when my drinks were empty. At this point I was already upset to continue to dine at this location. Maybe hiring more people would help offer better customer service. I would rather make the drive to my usual cpk than to come back here knowing I'll be waiting over 30 minutes.

I ordered a Chicken plate that was over cooked. It was 20 buck's so I expected something decent. Half the chichen was ok but the other half was dried out because it was over cooked. I let the waiter know and he asked me if I wanted to have it cooked more. I  said no thanks. He said ok and walked away. First time eating there and the last. Still left a decent tip because he did a ok job other than that. And my daughter is a server in a restaurant and I know they make minimum wage. My advice is to have management pay attention to food quality. 5 people over 100 dollars for a couple sandwiches a salad 1 small pizza, plate of crappie spagetti, and a chichen plate. 20 more dollars and we could have went to a nice steakhouse. I eat out a lot and I have to say probably the worst food I have had in many years. Olive Garden is one of my family's favorites. By far better food and not as expensive.

First time here, terrible experience, I felt rushed to order my food and ended up asking for something I was only iffy about as to not hold up my friend's orders. I asked for a small Mac and Cheese and the waiter told me there was only one size on the Mac and Cheese, this confused me because there was a Mac and Cheese listed under the "small plates" section of the menu but I said okay and the waiter took off. My friend then told me I should wave him down and clarify I wanted the "crispy Mac and cheese" from the small plates menu, so I spent 15 minutes trying to get his attention until he finally came over to adjust it. Once our food arrived, the crispy Mac and cheese was just 4 little balls of Mac and cheese fried and they were not good at all I didn't even end up eating them, extremely overpriced too. Once the waiter brought the checks everything was all mixed up, my friends lemonade was on my boyfriends check as well as my Mac and cheese, and they accidentally still charged me for the regular size. We pointed out all the mistakes and he went off to go fix it. 20 minutes later he comes back saying it's all been fixed and takes our cards. When he arrived with the receipts we noticed he charged my boyfriend's 23$ check on my friends card and my friends 15$ check on my boyfriends card. So they didn't even charge the right cards. By this point we were so disappointed with the service that we just left without adjusting the checks as to avoid waiting another 20 minutes. I will not be going back here unfortunately.

The worst. I'm sorry. You pay $15 for tiny little pizza that you get tiny little slices. $15 for a salad? And its not even good? Why on earth would I buy from CPK when Simi Valley has so many excellent pizza places? Ughhh. So incredibly disappointing. The worst Hawaain Pizza I have ever had.  The "Canadian bacon" was dry and honestly tasted like it was from a package or worse it tasted like turkey or something. There was no cheese to speak of. Just horrible. The sauasge, pepperoni and mushroom pizza was Al mushrooms and again where's the cheese?  So freaking bad. No care put into this food.

Let's start from the beginning here. We attended a fundraiser for our children's school. Made reservations days in advance. Showed up 10 min early and had no seats available as we sat waiting over 25 min we decided to ask to sit outside under a heater. After another 10 min we were seated outside. Our waiter was extremely slow, rude, and non familiar with any of the menu. After receiving our food, both children's dinners were cold, my mothers soup tasted like dirt, and my wife's pasta was not only ice cold but had no meat which we ordered in addition. After finally hunting down the server, we let him know the problems and his response was "ok so do you want a new one or want us to reheat it for you". Um, how about being a plate of food that's fresh and cooked. After many failed attempts of getting our food we asked for the manager. Who was very apologetic but didn't do much to fix the situation at hand except give us a gift card to return and give them another chance. Which is what we did. We just went yesterday and ordered take out. When my wife went in, she was greeted with extreme rudeness bc we were paying with a gift card. The manager came to help with the payment and did not acknowledge my wife at all. There was no bread in the bag so they got upset like it was our fault we wanted what comes with the order and said we can either wait or just take the food without it. If I could give ZERO stars I would!!!

Had a group birthday lunch here ... I wasn't so impressed with the service. We pre-ordered our lunch being that we were on a LUNCH BREAK and only had an hour to eat. Needless to say, we were waiting for our food just as long as if we had ordered when we got there. ''operation fail" .  I received my salad with two huge spoons .I don't know about you but I'm more interested in forking my salad.  The pepper shaker was being difficult, I almost threw my back out just to get NOTHING : /  (not user friendly at all) On the better side of this experience, the food was good and from the group feedback everyone enjoyed their choices. Three stars for the food ,2 more if they step up their service .

CPK is a great place to meet friends and family they know how to treat their customers  food is fresh  you need to try the apple martini and do not forget the deserts they are great no problem recommending them.

Been here a few times and was not satisfied.  I have been to other locations & had a great experience. I have been here twice with my family. Both times I got pizza and my family got other items. Both visits I got sick just hours after eating there. The first time I thought it was just me. But after the second visit, I knew it had to be the food. I have stopped eating at all CPK since then. The food tasted amazing. Everything else was wonderful. Just seemed like the pizza had a problem.
Nice place, like the warm roasted salad

Yay they changed the bread! The bread they give you when you are waiting for your food is finally yummy crunchy warm bread...I know you know what I'm talking about. My favorite is Moroccan spicy chicken salad. I miss the checca and foccacia and my son misses the kids cheeseburger pizza. It's probably what keeps up from frequenting here....

Came here on May 15th, 2013 with a friend for lunch. Had the Moroccan chicken salad. It was so damn delish! Super fresh, and full of dates, beets, chicken, all kinds of goodies. Our waitress, forgot her name was super friendly, and very attentive. The bread was hot and fresh. We sat outside. Its in the mall, so good people watching too. its nice and cool up there usually, breezy. I have been here a couple of times, and service and food is always good here. I will continue to come.

The pizza we ordered for some reason had no tomato sauce and a mountain of toppings overwhelming the pizza, all the sodas were flat and the roasted vegetable salad had so much dressing it was unbearable. I was definitely not a happy camper.

Keith our server was fabulous!!!! We had the ribeye steak, Waldorf chicken salad and also lettuce chicken wraps the food was excellent as always but it's all in the details and Keith did not disappoint! We came in a little later almost quarter of nine. Our greeter was very friendly which set the tone for the entire meal. If you have good food with outstanding help it makes the experience so much more memorable!  Thank you for taking time to hire Keith and all the others who worked in concert to make the night memorable.

Great service Inconsistent food quality  Horrific management (Lee Ann) Today I had a terrible incident at the restaurant and the manager Lee Ann was to busy to perform customer service when it was seriously required. I will never set foot again in this restaurant because of the disrespect I received from the manager Lee Ann. My health was placed at risk and she was to busy to address the incident that occurred. I am a very forgiving person but the way she treated me and my daughter is unacceptable.

My best visit to CPK here in Simi. Food was good and our waitress was awesome Kelsey.  Packed house today and our food was out quick. Fish tacos were really good and so was crusted Mac n cheese.  Good experience

It's not just pizza, nor is it your typical Italian place. Modern updated food items at an affordable price. I come here for the pizza, the thin crust at that. They have a big brick stone oven that more then half of their dishes are made in.  For me, there's always those two types of pizza I always fall back on, my go to pizzas if you will. The thin crust spinach and artichoke one and the spinach and mushroom flatbread. I have also eaten a variety of other items on the menu, from pasta to salad to dessert. When in season their strawberry fields salad is a must along with their s'mores dessert in a jar !!  One more thing: Make sure to get the pizza dough rewards card, after racking up 100$ you'll get a 5$ certificate. And you don't have to eat just pizza to rack up the points, it's for all their meals. The perks are endless, they also send you coupons throughout the year to save on your meals.

I know it's a chain, but you've got to respect and appreciate consistency.  It's nice to know what to expect in terms of quality and cost, but occasionally I'm surprised by new menu options. I remember first learning about CPK in college. Some friends from my dorm were telling me they were going to Emeryville to a place called "CPK". I had no idea wtf that was, but ever since I went to one in the Bay area, I've been a fan. I could comment on the many delicious pizzas but I'll highlight some other things I like here. (+) Strawberry iced tea (+) Avocado egg rolls (+) Tortilla soup (+) My usual Thai crunch salad is consistently solid, but I tried the chopped Italian salad and it was so good (+) Free kids meal with receipt from the mall train ride!

I really don't understand the hype about this chain. Their pizza is terrible. Ive had their catered food before and that was actually pretty good but that was from the woodland hills location. Will never eat here again. Overpriced and bland

Terrible customer service. We had a large party, asked for more bread right when we got the first bread, our waiter, Corey didn't bring it. We had to ask for bread from another waiter. They brought our appetizer out cold like it had been sitting for awhile and right after they brought out the food. We gave them the cauliflower back and chose we didn't want it anymore. They said they would adjust our bill and did not. So we paid for an appetizer we didn't even eat. I called after we left not realizing my husband paid for the appetizer and they offered a $15 gift card, but sadly it was my first and last time going to CPK so I refused I just wanted that $8 something back on my card, the funds cleared and they did not reimburse my card. It's only $8 but it's the point that matters, I shouldn't have to pay for something that we didn't consume. Horrible customer service, I couldn't find my waiter majority of the time, couldn't get a refill on drinks or on sauces, I will not be back. I did however enjoy my salad but you can not make up bad customer service for good food. Maybe they should hire more attentive waiters.

A Cup of Tea.  Last night 4 of us went to CPK around 6:30 for dinner. Our waiter asked for our drink order and I asked for a cup of tea. Just plain black tea. He said they didn't have black tea just herbal and green. Then I explained what black tea was and he said;"oh ice tea no ice". And he proceeded to bring me a glass of cold tea without ice. I pointed to the coffee my son-in-law had and said; "A cup of tea". Again he said;"we don't have that". So we left and went to Larson's. No tea no customers.

Update - After posting the review I was contacted by CPK and my bill was adjusted accordingly. Its good to know they at least care enough about customers to follow up and try to make things "right" so they get kudos for their follow up.

I ordered for pick up and had to wait 20 minutes for edamame. Once I got my food and got home, I realize they forgot my wife's Waldorf salad. However, I called and was immediately transferred to the manager, Jeff, who is sending us a gift card for the price of my wife's salad.  And, I owe them an apology, as apparently I had lots of potatoes underneath my steak.

Went today to CPK. Was not crowded at all at 4 pm. Had a pizza and jambalaya. Was excellent. Had Keith for a server. Was the best. Would highly recommend this restaurant. Management is doing a great job.

BY FAR my FAVORITE California pizza kitchen location. I live in northridge but will go out of my way just for the service I get at this location instead.  Mike runs a great restaurant and is very personable with everyone that comes in. The staff follows in his foot steps and from the hostess to curbside I've never had a bad experience. In the rare occasion the food isn't to my satisfaction I've never had a problem talking to them about it. Absolute love this store and Kai curbside always helps me quickly and my order is always right. Love the friendly service and personable people at this location!

A few of my coworkers and I placed an order for delivery, and the estimated time of arrival was around 12:45 and it didn't show up until after 1:45. Where we work is under 5 miles away so the fact that they were this late was disappointing. This wasn't the first time this has happened either. The noodles in one of the dishes were undercooked but other than that the food was just okay. We were able to call and get our money back for the order so they get a star for that. But if you're looking for a timely delivery you may want to look elsewhere.

Service was on point. Everyone was very nice and prompt when I needed something.  As I sat down, I noticed my utensils had food particles still on them... Not very hygienic and makes you think whether your food is also properly made. The food was ok. The BBQ chicken pizza was delicious but, pricey for a pizza that can be bought at another pizza shop. The artichoke and spinach dip was a little too oily for my liking.

I love how this place goes outside of the box with its flavor palettes! They have a good lunch combination section. Today I had a blood orange sangria (not much alcohol at all) with the half sandwich and half salad. The portions are perfect for me...I'm stuffed. I had the roasted turkey with Brie and pear sandwich with the Ceasars salad. I had them opt out the honey mustard for a side of sun-dried tomato aioli ( on the grilled veggie sandwich) it was different and good. Although this is a chain, I appreciate the flavors and the refreshing choices!

Good old CPK! The Simi Valley Town Center mall location is a typical CPK location.  Clean, inviting, and well staffed. Usually busy, but not too busy. Friendly servers but they can be a BIT slow at times.   Solid dining option.  4 stars!
I came here because my ten-year-old daughter recommended this place. The wait staff was really nice , the cucumber pineapple drink was awesome, and the pizza was delicious. So I totally recommend it.

The new owners are idiots.  CPK was bought by the idiots that own Chilis some years ago.  They took a great restaurant that did everything right and ruined it.  My wife and I never go any more and we use to eat there once a week.  We used to really love CPK.  Not any more. I'm my business I see this type of behavior.  The bigger but shittier company buys the much better smaller company and kills it.  Prevent the customer from knowing how good a restaurant can be and hopefully they won't complain too much about our shitty food and service.

Would give this place -10 stars if I could.  Split a meal for 6 people with a friend.  My credit card was charged twice.  Called the restaurant to rectify situation.  Took my name and number down.  NEVER received a call back from the manager.  Crooked!!

Do Not Tell Anyone About This. HAPPY NEW YEAR EVERYONE. My grandson and I decided to have dinner at CPK before going to his class. We walked in and it was still early with maybe 10 tables being occupied. The hostess was Isaiah who greeted and seated us promptly. He asked what we would like to drink and Jack asked for a Root beer float. Isaiah informed us that Cal Pizza Kitchen does not have root beer floats. Jack then asked for chocolate milk.  Isaiah upon seeing a little disapointet on this 5 year olds face immediately said he would have them make one for him. I asked if he would get in trouble for that and he said no, and proceeded to place the order. When he returned with the drinks Jack thanked him again. They were delicious. Way to go Isaiah for making my little buddies night special. And way to go California Pizza Kitchen for hiring a wonderful person. Thank You from Grandpa Ernie and Gradson Jack.

Had the Caesar salad for lunch today with my co worker. I was fine up until I got home.. turns out my stomach started cramping and turning , couldn't figure out why until later on when it all came back, thank you cpk for making me sick.

Went here for my cousins graduation and the waiters were great! We were a big party of 18 people and they managed to address all concerns, have our food out quickly and our cups consistently full. The blonde guy (manager) was really nice and helpful, always making sure we were well taken care of.

A bug crawled out of my salad. Took three bites before the bug crawled out. I told the waitress and she didn't even care. Acted like it was my fault. Didn't even offer me a new salad. Very disappointed.

Good pizza and great drinks. Desert was really good too. But do you think it would hurt if you attempted to clean the FILTHY floors that EVERYONE including management kept ignoring ?  Both the tile at the take out entrance (was that an entire pizza someone spilled or just half of one ? ) and the carpet was horrendous.

We have not been here in a long time because my husband only had a few menu items he liked and they are all gone. Well this month is pizza month and the shrimp scampi pizza is back so we meet family for dinner and he got caught in traffic and missed dinner BUT I ordered him a scampi pizza to go. When he got home  he opened the box of what he called his shrimp skimpy pizza and he was a bit sad. He put the slices into the oven to warm  and I came along and cut off a strip of the pizza and nuked it just to have a taste. Well, this is not the shrimp scampi pizza I remember, I was horrified to find my mouth on fire! I mean real painful heat from spice, lips burning, tongue burning, throat burning, tears in my eyes heat. I know this cannot be right I thought it was a bad joke the chef or waiter played on us BUT then I went to the internet and it turns out this is a modified shrimp scampi pizza. My husband came to get his warm slices from the oven and I warned him to which he snickered and said yeah right, you are not getting me to hand over my pizza that easily. Well now he is downing his large glass of ice water. We both agree this is not the scampi pizza we remember from the past BUT we might be back one more time before it goes away on Nov 2nd and if we do, we will say no red hot chili flakes.  You all have been warned, if you do not like spicy heat in your food "just say no to the chili flakes". Other than that our entrees for dine in were as good as I remember, all enhanced of course with fresh shredded parm. The Blue Cheese Wedge was a bit smaller than I remember but still tasted very good. I wish they would bring back some of the other dishes my husband likes as a blast from the past so we could go there as a family more often.
Great Happy Hour!  You should try it!!  Service was excellent!  Loved Julio!  Manager is beyond Gracious!  Flat Breads were great!  Loved the Pizza!  Highly Recommend!!

Here for dinner with a few of my friends last weekend.  Very crowded as Simi Valley has a significant lack of decent restaurants and a population of over 100,000 which leads to not enough seats for weekend dining. CPK is a great chain restaurant and is similar in quality to PF Changs, Bucca di Beppo, or Bubba Gumps, only specializing in pizza and salads.  You know what you are going to get from this chain as it consistently delivers quality taste, abundant portions, and excellent drink choices.   Service at this location is excellent and attentive.  Drink refills, extra napkins, period check ups on us, and quick return of the check at the end. The location is relatively clean and well maintained but be warned this location gets mobbed on the weekends.  Expect a wait to be seated unless you go to an early dinner.   Thank you CPK for an enjoyable meal.

I just had an AWESOME restaurant experience here with my granddaughter.  The Pizza was amazing.... BUT the service was off the chain (EXCELLENT).  Michael Kelly the new manager was attentive to EVERY guest in the place in a personable manner. I learned that he is a well traveled man for the east coast and that he was brought on from Flamingos. Our waiter was Chris and all I can say is that the service was EXCEPTIONAL. 5 stars all day. Hope they can keep it up.... I become a regular for sure.

I'm not surprised to see the low rating for this location! This is really too bad, as I've always loved this restaurant.  We came here for dinner last night and waited for over 10 minutes for service. We requested serving ware for our salad, which was never brought out, and I eventually started getting up to grab whatever flatware or condiments we requested and never received. The zinger was that our pizza was stale - the cheese or the vegetables on it had gone bad! The manager came over to address the pizza, and instead of acknowledging the problem, he discussed their quality check process. He didn't seem apologetic for our poor dining experience at all. I didn't want to risk getting sick -- I explained that the pizza was our dinner, and I didn't think I should have to pay for an incomplete meal, where I would now have to go elsewhere and pay for another meal. After some discussion, he agreed to comp our meal, but he clearly wasn't happy about it.  I wouldn't recommend this location to fellow diners - not worth the poor service or the risk of getting sick over stale food.

Ok Cpk mother's day super busy known fact. But Cody was super awesome, helpful and super knowlageble in terms of what he knows that is on the cpk menu. Ask for him next time your there he's seriously amazing thanks Cody for making it a special day for my mom.

A few days ago I went in with a couple of friends it was very busy but our Waitress Nikki F was OUTSTANDING!! She took us to her section with a  smile on her face. She got our drinks right away and we were ready to order and she took our order no problem. Food came out I got the bbq chicken pizza it was AMAZING!! I will be coming back because of Nikki and the great food ! Thank you cpk and thank you Nikki!!

Bleh. Terrible. When we got there, the restaurant was about 20% full, but the hostesses looked around confused and couldn't figure out where to seat out party of six.  Eventually, after about five minutes, they dragged us back to a corner booth by the bathroom (remember, restaurant barely full), and tried to squeeze us into a booth clearly designed for four people.  We sat before about 7 minutes before being approached by a server. Finally, the waitress came over, looked at our party squished in this booth, laughed, and moved us.  Thank gosh. She is the only reason for the second star. Otherwise, this would be a one star, honestly. She took our drink orders and walked away.  Then someone else came over and tried to take our drink orders. Uhhhh.  Why doesn't anyone know what is going on here. It isn't a busy night.   We got our drinks (my blackberry spritzer was the highlight of the meal, honestly) placed our order, then an expediter came over with food... that was not ours.  It belonged to the people behind us. Okay....  Eventually, the food came. It was decent. Just okay. Nothing amazing.  Took forever to get the check. This place needs to get their act together.

Love the lunch combination. The staff amazed of all. They are all so welcoming and sweet. Jackson did so well and made sure out food came out on time. I love this location and Jackson makes it better, he is a keeper! The BBQ pizza is by far the best. I love the fact that kids get menus and can color, which is great way to pass time with the family. Reasonable prices and great enviornment! Went to lunch one time with my sisters, LOVED IT. Chopped salad is the way to go!

First, let me say that I've worked in the restaurant industry for 16 years and I'm a tough customer (not really, I just pay very close attention to everything).  Our server was awesome! This review is from our late dinner on Monday 8/1/16 so kudos to our server in the front section of the restaurant at 8pm. Awesome job.  I had the chicken piccata & my boyfriend had the Ribeye steak "As rare as possible" ... Ick! But that's the way he likes it.  We were both happy with our meals and drinks. He had a Moscow Mule and I had a fruity specialty drink or drinks  (a coconut blossom or something? It had vodka, pineapple, coconut something or other and it/ they were amazing!!  We also ordered a strawberry shortcake to go. I'm glad we brought the strawberry shortcake dessert home. It was an awesome midnight snack for us.  Had a great dinner, awesome service, we will definitely be back.

My wife had a quinoa and arugula salad.   She had the half size and enjoyed it very much.   Loved the flavor and I even had a couple of bites and thought it was delicious.   When it came to my Hawaiian pizza the presentation was not impressive.   When biting into the pizza the ham was so big that the first bite of a slice took the ham right off.   And there was not much pineapple either.  So after the first bite there was no more toppings.  Very disappointing.   When it came to the bill the sangria that my wife ordered was $9.00.   The beer I got was $7.00.   Way to over priced.   I couldn't believe it.  Talk about price gouging.

I ordered take out and for some reason, the food made me super sick. I ended up vomiting twice and had to call out sick from work. Ugh. I ordered some pasta and a side salad. I'm guessing something wasn't fresh. Not going back.
Had the garlic chicken pizza barely any cheese barely any garlic no sauce basically piece of cardboard bread the worst pizza I've ever had

Oh CPK  I have given you chances and chances but I am done. Last night we were here (Monday- about 10 tables occupied) and ordered cocktails, bread with seasoned oil and meals.  The first thing that showed up was our meals.  The fettuccine was barely cooked, barely warm and had already dis-colored due to being under the heating lamp too long, pizza and Cobb salad were fine.   Then several minutes later our cocktails came out then bread. We love to enjoy a good cocktail but before our meal arrives with the bread.  While your here, what happen to my favorite Morrocan Salad.  I used to enjoy the abundance of chicken, dates, butternut squash and all of the other yummy ingredients.  The last 2 times my salad was a lettuce 5 tiny bit size pieces of chicken, and the rest I had to hunt down within the lettuce.  WHAt HAPPENED?
Daniel was a great server. He was very attentive to us during our visit. He was also so sweet to my five year old daughter. I truly appreciate good service and a great personality. (Simi Valley)

Wow, i was ready to give them another shot but was that a mistake. Where to begin...  1. Service was awful, there were 13 tables seated and 4 did not have food yet. It took 30 minutes to get a Jamaican Jerk Pizza and Lettuce Wraps.  2. Pizza was under cooked AND they forgot to put on the 'jerk' sauce that makes the pizza what it is. It then took them 5 minutes to get the sauce for us to the table.  3. Lettuce wrap filling seemed like it was sitting around as the chicken was tough, dry, and just plan bad. The lettuce was fresh though!!  4. Brought concerns up and was told 'sorry about that'.  5. Men's restroom hadn't been serviced in a long time. trash can overflowing with paper towels on the floor, soap dispenser out of soap, one toilet was absolutely disgusting.  6. Service was awful.  I think there is a reason this business is struggling in this location. The other locations are so much better. Really think about your time and money before going.

How the mighty have fallen... So not only does our waiter/bartender forget to bring out bread until half way into our meal, but you botch the order by forgetting my mom's pizza. It's one thing to own up to your mistake, but when you lie to our faces about forgetting to put our pizza order in (psst, we can understand Spanish and can hear you talking to the pizza chef right behind the bar) it is no wonder this place is freakin' empty on a holiday.  To the OTHER server that took our condiments in the middle of our meal because another table just sat at your table, yes we were using them still, but it's hard to interject when you walk away before we can respond.  Wait. The manager won't take our gift cards since the store doesn't have Internet?  Excuse me?   Seriously, WTF.

We have come here a few times, and each time it's the same. The food is pretty good, although the menu is limited. The food I would give 4 stars to, given that it's not expensive.  The service, however, has been awful both times.  Every time we've been they weren't particularly busy and yet everything took forever. We had to flag another server down to ask to have our order taken as our server was nowhere to be seen. Same story for getting the check and any refills.  Also the food took a really long time - we waited 50 mins for it to come out.  Needless to say we won't be back, which is too bad because the food is pretty good.

HORRIBLE management and curbside service experience! This location needs a new manager and more a experienced staff at curbside. Took an hour to get my order and I had to drive back because they forgot something that I ordered. I had to wait another 10 minutes to get it. End result...Cold pizza and no apologies. Highly recommend driving the extra mile to the Westlake location.
The Hawaiian bbq chicken pizza is my new favorite pizza here. Great twist to the classic bbq chicken pizza.  This location is consistent. Food is always fresh. Service is always good.
Great experience! The service was top notch, the food was delicious and we didn't have to wait long for our food. This restaurant is the perfect place to bring the family or even a date!

I am updating my review...Not based on the food (it is ALWAYS awesome and Fresh-when they have what I am looking for..), not based on the Service (Because that has never really been an issue), but based on a resolution of a concern! I had a concern, I was upset about what I felt to be poor planning on the Restaurants behalf, and the explanation behind it. I sent an email to Corp and posted a YELP review. I was not only called on the phone to dicuss, but received a very nice email recapping our conversation and inviting me back into their Restaurants. Bottom line is, they heard me, reacted and resolved!! That is enough to give it another chance....Thanks CPK for caring!!!
Love the carnitas tacos. Great flavor! I I also order the chicken on ciabatta Bread and a tortilla soup. Pizza is not that great

CPK is pretty consistent no matter where you go. Enjoyed the food. But the real reason for five stars was our waiter Osmin. He was wonderful! Not only was he on top of everything we needed he was a joy to talk to. Truly infectious happiness, enjoyed every minute of his service.

I rushed to the other side of town to meet up with some co-workers for lunch here. I'd read about the place and saw that it was kinda pricey, and pretty wait-ey. Since I only had an hour lunch, and a ten minute drive on top of that, I did my best to mitigate both aspects.  After I read the various yelp comments, I hopped onto the restaurant's website.  I perused the 'online order' section of the menu, so I could figure out what I wanted ahead of time, and see how much it was. I briefly looked at the 'loyalty' club, but it seemed too little reward for filling out a ton of info about myself. They dangled a free small plate in exchange for filling out volumes to sign up for their list. For the life of me, I couldn't figure out what the heck a small plate was. Turns out at California Pizza Kitchen, 'small plate' = 'one size smaller than an appetizer'.       Also turns out the small plates aren't quite as pricy as the rest of the menu.  The small plates range between two and six dollars. The appetizers start around tenish. The meals somewhere around eleven and up.  I knew where my wallet was aimed at.  Since I foresaw a dinner trip to Del Taco for Taco Thursday, I figured I'd get something kinda healthy.  The Petit Wedge seemed like it would accommodate, and it also actually looked pretty good. A chunk of iceberg lettuce, sprinkled with bacon, tomatoes, and finally covered with a blanket of blue cheese dressing.  Just under three hundred calories per the website, and only four dollars and sixty five cents. Cheap, healthy, and tasty. Not quite the cheapest thing on the menu, but it was pretty darn close.      Waiter guy came for our drink orders, and boy were we ready for him. We hit him with our drink orders, AND our meal orders right there. BAM. Before he had even left with our orders, I asked for the check as quickly as possible. BAM number two.  Then we waited. The place was pretty packed. I guess there was a fair or something going on in the parking lot nearby. There were lots and lots of co-workers were in here. I recognized many badges dangling from clips, but I only really knew the small group of people at my table. As I waited for my salad, I nervously looked at the time on my phone, hoping it would make the food come faster.  The check came early as I had requested, and it was handled just about immediately so that I could eat and run back to work. After a bit more waiting, finally, at 12:47, my wedge salad was placed before me. I sighed as I realized I had about three minutes to eat it and get out if I wanted to stay on schedule to get back to my desk on time. I did my best to wolf it down as quickly as possible. Despite the speed-eating, It was really good. It was a good sized slab 'o iceberg lettuce, cold and crisp. The plate it came on was also cold and refrigerated. It was well presented, and I really wished I'd had more time to savor it. I ran out the door, and ran back to my car.     All in all, I was only a minute late. So not too too bad. I hate to have seen how late it if I hadn't been prepared. I felt kinda bad for being a jerk to the waiter. He seemed like a nice guy.  I may or may not be back? The salad was pretty darn tasty. I definitely won't be back on a lunch hour though. They are still kinda pricy, and despite my efforts, definitely still pretty wait-ey.

My family and I had lunch there yesterday afternoon. We were greeted by a fantastic male host at the door and led to our table. Our server was pleasant but did seem busy. I believe he may have been the only server at this time? Moving on to food - this was the reason for the 3 stars. Actually the server earned those because the food was terrible and earned no stars .  Kids pizza was the worst. Overcooked  , super dried out and very little cheese. Our veggie thin crust we added goat cheese for 1.50 but they just sprinkled it on and not even on every slice.  Needless to say , we won't be back. Food quality was too lousy :/

The location is convenient. The food and service was good. I wasn't impressed on the cleanliness or children menu. I know forks and plates can come out of the dishwasher dirt but then they shouldn't put them on the table. We ordered the 5 cheese it was very good. Spinach dip was not good. My son didn't like the kids pizza. I tasted it and it was a different quality of pizza (not good at all). I would go back to a California pizza kitchen but only order the pizza off the adult menu. We will try this one again because the service was good.
It's decent here and the service is OK. They don't really go out of their way for any reason. The food is good but there can be a wait and it's a little slow and small here.

I am glad some change has taken place at this location.  We had decided not to spend our money at this location about a year a go when our entire experience was really bad to say the least. However, that is the past and my review today is about the wonderful visit we had recently. The first noticeable change is the attitude of the employees. From the moment we entered the restaurant, the hostess provided a very genuine welcome, took us to our table and handed over the menus. Shortly after, the server, whose name I can't remember, greeted us with a warm smile and helped us with the menu. The food we received was excellent! I ordered the Chicken Picata and my guest ordered their smoky Salmon. Great presentation and flavor. During our dining experience, for the first time ever, a manager touched our table. We were very please to see this because in past visits, the manager is the cook and never comes out of the kitchen. I am not sure of their philosophy but it was a refreshing experience to see such change. Now I don't have to go to other locations for wonderful food, when we have one location here.

Last night was my first time going to CPK, and I was very disappointed. My friend and I sat down and waited about 10 minutes for the waitress, when she arrived to our table she was very kind. We asked her what she recommended because it was our first time and she made a few suggestions, we ordered a pizza with cheese and tomato (I don't recall the name of it) and the 5 cheese ravioli. We shared both dishes once they arrived, and the pizza was okay, nothing to rave about. The ravioli was extremely disappointing, the sauce was decent, but the noodle had what tasted like bland ricotta cheese inside. I could have gotten ravioli at the grocery store for cheaper, and better quality ($14 for this dish which had roughly 9 noodles in it). We also got a free quesadilla, on the house for being first timers. It was pretty bland, not much flavor, but it was good for being free. When we got our check, we asked if we could split it and the waitress had a very fake smile when she said she would be right back. I work retail, I know how you sound and look when you're annoyed at a guest, she needs to be trained how to hide it better or something. But anyway, when we got our two checks back we gave her our cards wrapped in the receipts so she could tell which was ours. When we got the receipts back to sign, she had charged me for my friends purchase (which was 17 something as opposed to my 16 something tab) and my friend had only been charged $6.22 for some odd reason. We were so done at that point that we just tipped, signed, and walked out.  Thanks for the terrible service and nice discount! Not returning.

We did curbside pick-up for the first time and it was very easy.  The phone rep was very nice and gave us an exact time to arrive and call for our food to be brought out.  When we called, the server came right out.  I do wish they could process credit cards at the car instead of taking it inside and running it back out - I think this would be an easy thing for them to integrate.  When we got home, the food was great - until my husband bit into a small stick of wood.  That is NOT what you want, however, they  maintain their 4 stars because A) Stuff happens and B) my husband was very pleased with the response he received from the manager when he called to let them know.
Good food, quick service and decent prices, the atmosphere was quiet and the air conditioning was cool on a hot afternoon.

Excellent customer experience.  It all started with a phone call.  I called to inquire if they were busy and wanted to know how long the wait for 11 people.  Nathan indicated that the wait will not be long and asked me how many adults and kids.  When we arrived I was surprised that there was no wait and our table is ready along with the correct number of kid menus at the ready at our table. We usually order CPK traditional dishes like Spinach Dip and Thai Chicken Pizza but at this visit we decided to order the Butter Cake for dessert and OMG this dessert is Super Good.  All I have to say is you have to order this dessert the next time you are at CPK. Overall the service and food was excellent and the they also have a Baby Changing Station in the men's room which is important for my family.  I note this because not all CPK's have a Baby Changing Station.

Came in for a quick lunch while running around the mall. Brandy was our server and she was so wonderful. She was quiet busy but got to us promptly and helped answer our questions about an allergy one of us had. The manager Mike also came buy, checked on our food, and then brought it out to us even though we hadn't complained or weren't rushing. They were very attentive and willing to help as we enjoyed our lunch specials. The food always seems to be yummy also.
Very surprised with some of the new ..well relatively new starters. They are really tasty! Guacamole is addictive and the bread is yummy. Everything else is just over hyped on the menu though

I have been here a few times and I feel the service is getting better and better. If I would have wrote this a few months ago it would have been a 3 or 4 star review.  Last night my girlfriend and I went in for an earlier dinner (5-5:30) and the place was not all that busy. We were promptly seated 1 table in from the door. Our waiter (Matt) came over and immediately asked if we would like to move somewhere more quite and further back. Of course we did. So after he moved us to a much better table he took our drink orders and just as quick as we were seated we now had our drinks. Great and quick.  He then took our order which we wanted to modify some of the items on the menu which he had no problem doing. After taking our order he came back and said he had found a free "small plate" card and asked if we would like a free small plate. Who wouldn't want free food. So we tried the fried macaroni balls. They were delicious.  Then he saw we were finished brought us all new silverware and more napkins. Shortly there after he brought us our food which was delicious. I got the cheese ravioli and my girlfriend got some type of chicken pasta (I forgot the name) which I tried and was also very good. We have had the pizza there which everyone knows is very good.  All and all thanks to Matt for the great service and the kitchen staff for getting great food out quickly. This has become a place we are going more and more often!! Also side note we have popped in here for a quick drink and small plate at the bar and have had Dave many times and he is always so friendly!!
Great place and consistantly good. Off menu, try the carmalized peach salad with chicken. Its always a bit cold inside, but waiter John is the defintion of customer service, the best guy they got.

FOOD QUALITY (4 stars):  so far, so good---more good dishes than bad. * favorites: - Portabello mushroom ravioli: DELISH! - Avocado club eggrolls: yummy! - Lettuce wrap: good w/ both chicken and shrimp - broccoli sun-dried tomato fusilli  - Field greens salad - the original bbq chopped chicken salad - CPK cobb salad with beets - red velvet cake (so moist and perfectly sweet) * MIGHT order again: - Wardolf chicken salad - shrimp scampi pizza (flavorful but didn't like the thin crust) * would NOT order again: - Singapore eggrolls (bland) - Thai linguine ( too sweet) -  the Works Pizza SERVICE (5 stars): fast, friendly, and professional. PRICE (3 stars): you pay for what you get, BUT would be better if the dishes were less pricey. BONUS: gotta love their "Don't Open IT and WIN" promo! My friend and I have won $120 worth of food! thank you CPK!  OVERALL: 4 stars for running their awesome promo, which made me try more stuff on their menu! yaaaaaaay for CPK- Simi Valley.

It used to be amazing! My girlfriend and I would eat here every week! But then they started changing up the dishes and sadly we will not return. They changed up the chipotle chicken pizza first which is one of my favorites and then they began slowly changing other dishes. We waited it out for awhile hoping it was only temporary but sadly it is not. We will not be returning.
Was able to get a wild mushroom pizza on a gf crust.  I appreciate having that option, and enjoyed it, but their prices are high.  Along with an appetizer it was almost $17.

After coming here a few more times...and them trying other places to eat I realized they deserved a better review. Like I said previously, food and service is good. I've never had a problem and the servers have been very friendly and helpful. My experience has been good!

These two stars are for our waitress and our bartender. The hostess and the manager should consider career changes. When a party of 7 (including a 2 year old) is told 15 mins to be seated and 35 go by and no one has approached them, what is the next natural thing to do? So I asked to speak to the manager. Why? What's wrong? The concerned server inquires. I explain, we were told 15 mins, that was 35 mins ago and there's an empty table of 4 and an empty table for 2 right next to each other and it has been vacant for about 8 mins... 3 mins later we are seated... The manager comes over. Has no idea of what has happened. So I explain. No apology, quite the contrary, he excuses the hostess' mistake, and was almost accusatory toward me that I was trying to make a problem out of a normal restaurant occurrence. It wasn't his 2 year old who was eating his own arm because he was starving... When is it ever in a businesses best interest to argue with an already pissed off customer who has a valid complaint. Guess this guy dropped out of Clown College (sorry to offend and professional clowns) cause it wasn't funny. Then our amazing waitress shows up, asks if we've had a chance to look over the... Oh wait, no one thought to bring menus. Better start studying online before you go to CPK in Simi... Our waitress, embarrassed, rushes to take our drink order and had asked a coworker to get us menus. We are approached and asked how many kids menus.... There were 6 obvious adults and 1, count him, 1 2 year old, eating his arm. 5 mins later still no menus. So my sister goes and gets us menus. Our waitress rushed bread out to us as we have now been waiting for an hour. The food took another 40-50 mins to arrive. I'm just confused about how 2 minimum wage workers know enough to apologize for the inconvenience and do their best to play catch up and the higher paid manager was rude, uniformed and condescending.  Just for the future CPK, an honest apology goes a lot longer then a jerky excuse and throwing $ at the bill. You can only buy so much loyalty. I guess if you don't care how you're treated you can continue to go here, but I deserve better then poor excuses.
our server was really rude. waited 10 mins to get his attention everytime we needed something. the food was great but service was poor.

Mmmmm.  Yum.  Pricey, yah sure.  But, oh so tasty.  My mother gives rave reviews to the Greek Pizza.  I can highly recommend the Moroccan Chicken Salad, and I believe my dad had the California Club Pizza.  We usually just get water, it is cheaper.  I will say they have some tasty lemonade though, I asked ahead of time if the refills were free just cause I'm  tool.  And, at least for soft drinks, I guess refills are a given.  Portions are above average to hefty, so consider ordering 1/2 sizes on salads, or sharing an entree.  Bon appetito!  Kind, friendly service on our front,  thanks Josh.

CPK is a great place to eat with the kids, and you can't beat the BBQ Pizza.  Also, they have a great BBQ Chicken Salad. Someone said they were surprised that this is called Italian food - I don't really see them doing that anywhere.  Pizza, while decidedly of Italian origin, has actually become quite freeform - especially with the "California" moniker.  I'm surprised there isn't avocado on every pizza!  I think the expansion of what people think of as pizza is largely due to these folks and that's something I'm rather glad about.  Maybe I'll get kicked out of the goomba club, but any real paisan knows that good food is good food, even if it isn't the way Mama made it. Anyway, its true - don't go here if you are looking for homestyle Italian food or classic pizzeria style pies  - but, do come here for an eclectic menu with great pizzas, pastas, salads and more. Deserts are also quite good...

All CPK's are the same except this one.  The have variations that I have never seen at any other CPK.  There is nothing original about their "original" barbecue chicken pizza.  Words can't describe how awful it is.  There's three tiny tiny strips of chicken on it, enough barbecue sauce to dip your chicken fingers from McDonald's in.  They think they are being innovative when they should just stick with what works.  I will add that the staff was very friendly.

Service sucks, food was fine, our drinks were barely refilled unless you put the glass on the edge of the table. Over all not impressed . This was our second time here and equally disappointed in the waitressing staff.  They were friendly both times we went but no sense of urgency, bland personality like robotic , just meh.......

Celebrated Kevin's relay win on Saturday with his favorite... Pizza! It was really good. We ate outside. The waiter was great - got us everything quick and was very nice and friendly. I got the wedge salad and the thin crust four season; tasty! (One pizza is enough for two.) There are lots of items from which to choose.

Our group of four had an excellent lunch experience today, due in large part to the extra attention, patience, and great service from our server Chris. He even brought a small sample to our table so we could try a sauce before ordering the item. GREAT job, Chris - thank you and we will be back!
Great food. Good vibe. I get the Chicken Melanese or the Chicken Waldorf Salad. Good lunch vibe. hmmm.

booo. these guys are sneaky. i ordered a glass of pinot grigio , and had a second glass. when the bill came i was shocked to see that a basic pinot grigio glass was almost 10 bucks.  partially my fault. the menu says half glass was 4.50.  a half glass.  .... that part is my fault. didnt read it right. but nowhere have i been charged so much for a basic pinot grigio. total rip off.  most places will charge 4-7 bucks for the exact same wine.   food was fine, service was fine..but read the print.. and dont get ripped off like i did

i just love CPK. always have.  always will. their avocado rolls are always so tasty.  i will usually try to find something different each time i go there, so this time i had their "new" california club....aaaamazing. i was nervous it was going to be your typical club with like 5 layers or rough bread that tears your mouth apart with each bite, not at all....it was totally different than i ever imagined and way better than my taste buds were expecting.  you can choose either grilled chicken or turkey. avocado. tomatoes. etc...but the bread was some kind of cheese & herb bread. it was full of flavor. our server was great. on point with refills without asking...points. love the CPK.
Pricey for what you get, but the food is always good. Service can be hit or miss, but 90% its a hit. Like that manager is seen talking to customers.

I would love to give this place 5 stars for the food, but I have to equate the service in my review...which really was atrocious!  I met a coworker for lunch around 11:45am before the crowd showed up and it took the server over 10 minutes to greet me and take my drink order! This was just the beginning and a glimpse into how the rest of the meal would play out.  Ive been a server before and I know when the rush comes you get sat multiple tables at once, which is why servers need multi-tasking abilities. Ours, did not! I give a lot of leeway to servers since I can appreciate what they do but there is a point when even I have had enough! A servers catch phrase should never be "I'm so sorry!"..I honestly heard our server say that to us and other tables 12 times during our hour and a half long meal. At least we weren't the only ones receiving horrible service! The food here however is ALWAYS good! Train the staff to handle the tables they have or lessen the stations tables! Her tip was greatly effected.

I have been to other CPK's and they were ok so I always bothered my husband to take me to this one. He kept telling me it's not that great, but we had a coupon for my son to eat for free so we headed on up. We weren't really gretted at the front door as there was nobody at the host station. When we were greeted we were told as soon as the table was clear we'd be seated. It took them 5 minutes to get someone to clear the table. When we were finally seated it took them 10 minutes to come over and take our drink order. Then we waited another 10 minutes for them to come over and take our food order and not once did anyone say, be right with you, or apologize for completely neglecting us. I would be understanding if they were swamped and the waiters/waitresses showed some urgency, but our waiter sat and gabbed at each table for 10 minutes which is why it took 20 minutes before we got the chance to order. I am sure this place could be good, but with entitled employees, unless you have a really good manager the service just ruins the experience. I won't be coming back here. This wasn't my first tme with bad experiences here either. I did takeout 2 other times and they got my order wrong one time and I had to wait for them to remake it, and the other time I gave them 10 minutes extra on ready time and when I arrived it still was not ready. That should have been my first clue the dining room experience would not be that great.
first time in many years that we were thoroughly pleased with the service, the wine/beer, the salads and the pizzas at this location

Went out with hubby for dinner and a movie, the server was nice and friendly. The drinks were very good. Try the premium margarita. One of the better ones I've had. Prices are good and you get large portions that you can save for later. The dessert menu could use an overhaul. Not many selections for desserts. Overall had a nice time.

Always has great food and good service. There is a good variety of choices for all kinds of diets. The salads are amazing and there are plenty to choose from. The atmosphere is calming and it a great place for a lunch date or an office meeting.

The pizzas here are just average. I did prefer the crispy thin crust pizzas over the original ones. The reason for the 2 star rating however is I feel like they are way overpriced for what you get. If you want to have CPK and save money just go to Costco or  your local supermarket and buy them frozen. Unfortunately though, the crispy thin crust pizzas  I believe you cannot buy frozen.

I wish I could rate this place with zero stars. The service was so poor that I will not only never come to this establishment again but all CPK's. The pizza isnt that great anyway. I along with two friends were excited to go to CPK, its used to be a great place to meet up and enjoy good pizza. However this time the service was so terrible that it was almost amusing. When we walked in, we were ignored for a good 5 minutes, mind you the restaurant was not busy at all and there was no one waiting. Actually the restaurant next door, Red Robin was packed. We should've gone there... anyway, after a couple of minutes Natalie (the host) greeted us, finally!  In the middle of asking us, "how many people..," what I assumed was her co-worker, walks in and Natalie's face lights up and all of a sudden she is happy to be working there. Her co-worker chooses the table and server on the ipad and they walked away, giggling and making lovely conversation. Meanwhile, my friends and I are standing there in shock that we were completely ignored. We decide to stay despite the host's incredibly rude behavior... and boy was that was a mistake!  Our waiter seemed nervous, maybe his first day? We were not sure. Anywho, we placed our orders and the waiter accidentally dropped the plate on the other dishes with food making it splatter on everything including ourselves, oh but that wasn't the best part. When the plate landed on the other food he said, "just eat it, its still good." I couldn't help myself and bust out laughing. He thought the food that was half on the table and the other half that was on us was still good. Umm, is that a fetish or something?  I asked him to clear the table and please try again. I nor my friends had any plans to lick the table or eat off each other. I'm honestly still shocked that he would say that.  The second time was the charm and all the food managed to stay on the plate and in our belly's. Sadly, he really didn't check up on us after that; no refills, no "how is everything?", no service, or check. I actually went up to the manager to ask for the check.   Thank you waiter and host! You made for slightly amusing conversation and an eventful dinner.  Pros of this location, there is plenty of parking... and its probably because people are choosing other places.

Came here for lunch with the Mrs on a warm Sunday afternoon. We were seated promptly, the location was not busy, and the climate was refreshing and cool. The first thing I noticed is that since the last time I had been here, things have changed. There was a new app/rewards card deal, the menu had been simplified to one size fits all pizzas, and they have joined the craze of restaurants offering simple, cheap appetizers in the $3-$5 range.  For joining their e-club, you get a free 'Small Plate' which is their mini appetizer, so take advantage of that if you haven't already. The other 'perk' to their club is that if you spend $100, you get a $5 coupon. This is cumulative, and it's better than nothing, but I don't know how many people out there are so crazy about CPK that this deal is that pertinent, especially with the variety of dining in the town center, or pizza choices like Toppers still being around. Regardless of the e-club, the service was fast and friendly. We got our drinks ordered right away, and they never stopped being refilled. Their Arnold Palmer has always been one of my favorites, and on a hot day, it was doubly appreciated. The waitress gave us ample time to figure out our selection, explained the E-club, and explained that pizzas were 'personal' sized, 6 slice pizzas. I think that two people could get by on one pizza, and either a full appetizer, or even one of the 'Small Plate's.  We requested the Spicy Chicken Quesadilla for our Small Plate, and it was good. It came with a self proclaimed "Ranchito" sauce that I wasn't so fond of, but the quesadilla itself was good. For our main course we had the Pepperoni Pizza and the Habanero Carnitas pizza. Both pizzas were good, and the Habanero Carnitas pizza has the sensibility to come with the habanero salsa on the side. And do believe the menu when it says that this salsa is hot. I think I might have had a bad experience had it been on the pizza by default, and I love spicy food. The service was great throughout. When our main waitress couldn't get to us, we had two other girls swing by, one to bring out the pizzas fresh, and one to grab our drinks whenever low. Our waitress boxed up our food and made sure we were satisfied before bringing the check. The entire experience was good, not 'oh my god I must eat here often' great, and the food is a little pricey at $12+ a pizza.  CPK is in a weird spot, in that it kind of wants to be fancy, but it serves pizza. This is a problem I have personally with the idea of CPK, as opposed to something specific to this location. I think the CPK ASAP locations had the right idea, but I believe those are gone now.

Great new menu! I had not been to CPK in awhile. Not that I don't like their food, but just had fallen away from their regular menu. CPK has a few new items that are really worth trying AND are lower in calorie! Chile Relleno -  a new take on the chile relleno. Instead of being battered and deep fried, it's a pasilla chile that is roasted and then stuffed with a chicken cheese vegetable mixture. it's SO good. It's served on a plate with a little bit of their tortilla soup that is sort of like a sauce. The flavors in this dish are excellent!! AND it's about 380 calories. NOT BAD :-) The other dish that I'm a fan of is the Chicken Chimmichurri - grilled chicken with roasted vegetables (such as broccoli, cauliflower, and other hearty greens). The chimmichurri sauce was super. it had heat to it but lots of flavor. I always thought that was a misnomer - hot is hot.. but not with this dish. I highly recommend.  So if you're looking for some variation, try the new menu items!  Buen Provecho!
I thought the service was fair food over priced. I am not a fan of added tips charges to my bill. Im the giving tip for service. I will not return for that reason only.

I just dont get the hype. Im not exactly sure how people can compare this food to real Italian food. And how can they call it a Pizza Kitchen if they only serve individual sized pizzas? I have tried multiple meals here and have ALWAYS left disappointed and unsatisfied. Bad excuse for Italian... Go to Macaroni Grill or even the Junkyard if you want some real homemade Italian.

Food is amazing! Service definitely sucks. I called in an order went to pick it up and we were missing 2 entrées. We called back and they said they would refund me the money....still haven't gotten the 13 bucks back.  Not the first time this has happened either
Always a family favorite place to visit when we're out shopping at the town center. Friendly staff, great food!

Had a quick business and lunch meeting with a good friend for lunch.  The service was EXCELLENT. The servers Cheyenne, Summer, Amberlyn and manager Jim were very upbeat and great personalities. We got some history BBQ pizza started 25yrs ago at CPK; and we had some humor moments with the staff.. HA! We loved it. Well, our pizza crust wasn't over cooked and we ate the crumbs ha.

We sat at the bar and ordered beers and a couple of appetizers to share.  Our server was fantastic.  We never lacked for anything during our time there.  He even changed the TV channel for us to watch a preseasn football game.
