The food was great and plentiful.  The beer was cold but could have been colder.  They only have 4 beers on tap so a larger selection would be a nice treat.   The only downside was the dreaded employee meeting that took place in the middle of our snacks.  It just leaves everyone in the restaurant hanging while the employees are hunched in the corner of the kitchen doing their Cheesecake Factory impression.  Can't those meetings be held before the restaurant opens?

Total Rating: 3.5 out of 5. I can't give half stars, but there it is. I would give 4.5 if the pricing was cheaper, but alas this is for sure a "spendy" place for portions you get. I came after volunteering for 5 hours at the Simi Valley Days Fair for Special Children.  This place was PACKED.  I am giving 1 and 1/2 stars for the level of service we got.  I would like to state for good service I usually only give 1.  Service started extremely slow.  They obviously weren't prepared for how many customers were going to be coming in due to the fair, but they accommodated as time progressed.  I'm guessing maybe an extra server showed up or something. My friends ordered wedge salads and the fried macaroni and cheese balls dish.  The fried dish seemed a bit petite for my taste.  Especially considering the price.  For an adult with a small stomach this may be appropriate. This place is literally called California Pizza Kitchen, so I ordered a hand-tossed Pepperoni Pizza!  Let's see how good this pie is.   I would give it the same rating I gave this entire review.  3.5 out of 5.  It is barely anything special, but that by no means doesn't mean it was bad.  Same problem as others, for the price the sizing is a little small. The place looked and felt clean and "fancy shmancy" (Fake luxury... But in a good way). CPK: Keep everything about the place the same and either lower your prices or bulk up on the size of your dishes for more 4.5 - 5 stars I would suggest going here again.  I would not suggest this to pizza grease haters.  The pizza was a bit greasy.  I feel really bad for the guy who served us, but he did a fantastic job under the situation.
Just walk right in straight over to the bar. No one here yet 12:35 on a Monday place is starting to fill up. I just stop by to try a appetizer - lettuce Wraps with chicken. Yum real good  8.99
Ate dinner here tonight and my experience wasn't very pleasant. It took a while for our food, and our server, Briana, was clueless and disappeared a lot. This place has definitely gone downhill
I've been going her for the past year and every time it's been a great experience.  Everyone from the G.M. to the hostess

Good food.  Service sucked.  We called ahead of time so our table can be ready... It wasn't.  We called ahead of time to place our food order... It took just as long as if we ordered there.  Friends bday lunch was not a happy one... BOO CPK!

Brutal. My cousin's order was wrong, my uncle's salad had a walnut shell, their "caramelized peaches" were straight out of the can and not even heated, and my pizza was cold. In an attempt to spare a scene the manager promised free dessert to anyone who wanted it. However, when we got the bill they charged us for the two children's desserts. This was my first and last time to CPK. Cheers

Went here to share a few pizza's with family before going to Reagan Library. We expected to be "in and out" quickly and get to the museum in plenty of time. For some reason our food took forever to come. Over 45 mins! We were loosing museum time. We complained to the manager who was professional, corroborated our story as he knew when we were seated and took care of the situation by comping our meal. The food/pizza was excellent and actually the server was very nice the whole time. I don't know if he was overwhelmed by customers in the restaurant as were sitting on the patio (weather was awesome) or maybe he forgot to put in the order (being a waitress long ago I have to admit I had done this once or twice). We did loose time at the Reagan Library and pretty much ran through the exhibit. But luckily we live close by, but not the in-laws (they are from New York). But we left here happy that the manager "stepped up" and took care of things.  I hope this restaurant does well. It's new, clean, spacious and it has a nice patio seating area and most importantly.....good food.  We hope to be back and give it a second chance.  Again - special thanks to the manager.

CPK is pretty consistent with the food quality.  Almost every time I go there, we order the Tostada pizza and the Thai Crunch Salad.  I think I've tried every pizza on the menu (except for the Hawaiian; pineapple does NOT belong on a pizza!!) and all of them are good!  Enjoy!!

Located in the Simi Valley Town Center, this CA Pizza Kitchen is like any other. The service was decent and the food was good.  We stopped by here when we went to see Santa before christmas. We got the thai chicken pizza and the kids shared a cheese pizza with broccoli on the side. The kids menus were good and they colored to keep busy. While we waited my wife and I switched off going shopping.  Sitting outside was great because we didn't feel guilty when the kids got rambunctious. They have heating lamps outside to keep warm with and a full bar inside if you need to get warm that way. I don't say it often, but our waitress was pretty cute too.

I was at CPK at the Simi Valley Town Center yesterday with my mother and brother around 6pm and we were among the only people there. Our waitress was great, but I don't remember her name unfortunately. When we finally left, I accidentally left my Rayban sunglasses on the table and went shopping. About 15 minutes after we left the restaurant, I noticed my glasses were missing. I ran back to the restaurant and was greeted by the Manager, a tall big bald guy. He told me that they hadn't recovered any sunglasses but that if I left my name and number and description he would give me a call if they showed up. I left my info, but figured he was odd because he was keeping my by the door and seemed in a rush to get me out of the restaurant. So I left, and returned a few minutes later with my brother and walked right in to speak to my waitress this time. I asked her if they had seen my glasses and she said they did and that the bus boy turned it in to the manager. At this point I was confused. The manager came back to me and he asked "can I help you?". I responded "I know I was just here but you said you didn't find my glasses but they couldn't have gone anywhere since I just ate here 20 minutes ago and the place is dead. My waitress said you have them." He looked at her and then went to go get them. When he left, she asked me if he was being helpful. I said he was at first, but now I'm upset. He then returned with a couple pairs of glasses and said "didn't you say it was black?". I said "no I didn't I said brown/tortoise, and I even wrote it down." At this point it was clear to me that he tried to get me out of there before I could ask anyone else if they had seen my glasses. Such a shame that management would lie to their customers to keep their belongings. I spent over $100 on the glasses and he went through that to lie to me. So I would not recommend this restaurant because the management is very disappointing and shady. But I do thank my waitress very much for helping get them back. As for the big bald manager, I believe he should be fired immediately. Such a shame. Not management material whatsoever.

Great service, great looking restaurant, and great food! Our server was Casey. Very energetic and helpful/patient guy [lets face it, my family gets really picky about what they eat; no grease, wheat instead of white, etc] and he got everyone exactly what they wanted. The food was tasty as usual, and the views were great! Gotta love eating where you can see the whole city. The place was a little busy, but they still managed to get 11 of us [plus a highchair] seated on a Saturday night in only 15 minutes. Love 'em!

I dont like this place because they overprice everything. I often go to the CPK in Thousand Oaks and I always get the personal Hawaiian pizza. At the Thousand Oaks CPK the personal Hawaiian pizza is always about 8 bucks. I'm on a budget and my limit is not spending more than 10 dollars for lunch. When I went to the CPK in Simi Valley the same personal pizza was about 12 bucks. Why in the world would they decide that at one location the same item is 4 dollars more? This is the problem with the entire Simi Valley Town Center.  Some moron decided that they would make it into a place for high class rich people who can overpay for everything. Give me a break.
